definition: (sports) to extend the duration of a game (due to stoppages)/(abbr. for 傷停補時|伤停补时[shang1 ting2 bu3 shi2]) injury time
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: Brush or roller for small areas and touch-up only.
sentences.chinese: 小面積施工或修補時可採用刷塗或輥塗。

sentences.english: Moyes sent on Beattie and McFadden for stoppage time.
sentences.chinese: 在補時階段莫耶斯換上比蒂和麥克法登。

sentences.english: Not even the gift of an injury-time penalty was enough to help Chelsea turn their fortunes around.
sentences.chinese: 即使有補時階段的點球也無法幫助切爾西逆轉。

sentences.english: France then got a penalty in injury time and he held his nerve to put it away.
sentences.chinese: 補時法國隊又得到了一個點球，他又控制自己罰進了。

sentences.english: Kalou completed the scoring in added time.
sentences.chinese: 卡勞在補時階段打進第三球。

sentences.english: His injury-time winner over Aston Villa changed all that.
sentences.chinese: 但傷停補時打進維拉的那個球完全改變了這一切。

sentences.english: It was the second time this year Hucles scored an injury-time winner.
sentences.chinese: 這是胡可思今年內第二次在補時階段攻入制勝球。

sentences.english: On average, in Spain, injury time is about three minutes.
sentences.chinese: 在西甲，傷停補時平均爲3分鐘。

sentences.english: In the two games United have led they have played an average 304sec of injury time.
sentences.chinese: 在頭兩輪曼聯贏得了平均304秒的補時時間。
